alert.note: Alert for Morgan County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 6:53PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Morgan and north central Washington Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 653 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Midway to near Antelope Springs, or along a line extending from 7 miles west of Akron to 12 miles northeast of Fort Morgan. Movement was west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Brush, Hillrose, Prewitt Reservoir, Antelope Springs, Snyder and Midway. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.
